Legal_Issue: Can the Respondent be held in contempt and face imprisonment for failing to pay a fine and costs as per the April 7, 2006 Order?
Governing_Law: Rule 466(1)(b) and Rule 471 of the Federal Courts Rules
Evidence_Assessment: Evidence confirmed service of the April 7, 2006 Order and non-compliance by the Respondent
Decision_Outcome: Respondent found in contempt; Warrant of Committal issued for imprisonment
Legal_Rule: Non-compliance with court orders can result in contempt findings, fines, costs, and imprisonment if monetary penalties are not paid
Procedural_Issue: Respondent did not appear despite being served notice of motion
Grounds_for_Claim: Failure to pay $2,000 fine and $1,000 costs as ordered on April 7, 2006
Key_Evidence_Considered: Service documents, proof of non-payment, Respondent's submission of irrelevant documents
Applicant_Challenge: Enforcement of court order through contempt proceedings
Court_Result: Warrant of Committal issued; additional $1,000 costs assessed
Defendant_Response: Did not appear or comply; submitted irrelevant documents
Remedy_Requested: Warrant of Committal, imprisonment, payment of outstanding fine and costs
Outcome: Warrant issued, Respondent held in contempt
Remedy_Sought: Imprisonment due to non-payment, additional costs
Resolution_Mechanism: Ex parte motion leading to Warrant of Committal
Applicable_Process: Contempt proceeding under Federal Courts Rules

Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to comply with a court order
Violation_Type: Failure to comply with court-ordered financial obligations
Legal_Issue: Can the Respondent be held in contempt and sentenced for failing to comply with a previous court order, including non-payment of fines and costs?
Governing_Law: Rule 466(1)(b) and Rule 471 of the Federal Courts Rules
Application_Facts: Respondent was served with April 2006 order requiring $2,000 fine and $1,000 costs; failed to pay despite reminders
Decision_Outcome: Respondent found in contempt; Warrant of Committal issued
Remedy_Requested: Warrant of Committal, imprisonment, additional costs
Court_Ruling: Contempt established; imprisonment ordered due to non-payment
Defendant_Behavior: Failed to pay, did not appear, submitted irrelevant documents
Grounds_for_Claim: Non-compliance with prior court order regarding fine and costs
Legal_Standard: Contempt for failure to comply with court orders under Federal Courts Rules
Assessment_Factor: Service confirmed, no valid excuse for non-compliance
Procedural_Issue: Ex parte motion filed due to Respondentâ€™s absence
Evidence_Used: Testimony on service, documentation of non-payment
Application_Basis: Failure to meet financial obligations under court order
Evidence_Assessed: Proof of service, lack of payment records
Cause_Description: Non-compliance with a prior court order and failure to pay imposed fines and costs
Evidence_Handling: Witnesses testified about service and compliance attempts
Evidence_Assessment: Sufficient evidence of service and non-compliance
Decision_Rationale: Contempt justified due to willful non-compliance without justification
Legal_Standard_Applied: Contempt under Federal Courts Rules for non-compliance
